faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most important questions about IJP and our placement services.
faq.moreQuestionsDesc: Our team is happy to answer all your questions personally.

employer.q1: How do I register my company?
employer.a1:
Registration is simple and free:

1. Click on "Register" in the navigation
2. Select "Register as a company"
3. Enter your email address and a secure password
4. Complete your company profile with contact details and description
5. You can create job listings immediately
employer.q2: How do I create a job listing?
employer.a2:
After registering and logging in:

1. Go to "My Job Listings" in the dashboard
2. Click on "Create New Job"
3. Fill in all relevant fields:
   - Job title and description
   - Requirements (language skills, qualifications)
   - Location and salary
   - Job type (Skilled worker, Ausbildung, Seasonal job, etc.)
4. Publish the job

Tip: The more detailed your information, the more suitable applicants you'll receive.
employer.q3: What costs are there for employers?
employer.a3:
Our pricing model:

• Posting job listings: Free
• Viewing applicant profiles: Free
• Successful placement: Commission only upon successful hiring

We're happy to discuss the exact terms individually with you. Contact us for a non-binding offer.
employer.q4: How does the application process work?
employer.a4:
The process is transparent and efficient:

1. Application received: Applicant applies for your position
2. IJP review: We check the documents for completeness
3. Forwarding: Suitable candidates are forwarded to you
4. Your decision: You review the applications and invite for interviews
5. Hiring: If interested, you hire the candidate

You have access to the status of all applications in your dashboard at any time.
employer.q5: What documents do I receive from the applicant?
employer.a5:
Depending on the job type, you receive:

For all applicants:
• Resume (CV)
• Passport photo
• Passport/ID copy
• Language certificates (if available)

For skilled workers additionally:
• Professional degree/diploma
• Employment references
• Qualification certificates

For students/seasonal workers:
• Enrollment certificate
• University certificate

All documents are checked by us for authenticity and completeness.
employer.q6: Which countries do the applicants come from?
employer.a6:
Our applicants mainly come from:

• Eastern Europe: Ukraine, Moldova, Georgia, Armenia
• Central Asia: Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan
• Other countries: On request

All applicants have the necessary requirements for employment in Germany or we support in obtaining the necessary permits.

applicant.a1:
It's that easy:

1. Register for free as an applicant
2. Complete your profile with all relevant data
3. Upload your documents (resume, certificates, etc.)
4. Browse available job listings
5. Apply with one click

Alternatively, you can "Request IJP" - then we actively search for suitable positions for you.
applicant.a2:
The required documents depend on the job type:

Student Summer Job:
• Passport
• Enrollment certificate (with translation)
• Passport photo
• BA declaration

Skilled Worker:
• Passport
• Resume
• Professional degree/diploma
• Employment references
• Language certificate (recommended)

Ausbildung:
• Passport
• School certificate
• Resume
• Language certificate (min. B1)

All documents should be uploaded as PDF.
applicant.a3:
Yes, our service is completely free for applicants!

We finance ourselves through placement commissions paid by employers. There are no costs for you as an applicant - neither for registration, nor for application or placement.
applicant.q4: What language skills do I need?
applicant.a4:
The requirements vary depending on the position:

Student Summer Job/Seasonal Job:
• German: A2-B1 (basic knowledge sufficient)
• English: Helpful, but not mandatory

Skilled Worker:
• German: B1-B2 (depending on profession)
• Profession-specific certificates may be required

Ausbildung:
• German: At least B1
• B2 is recommended for vocational school

Tip: The better your German skills, the more job opportunities are available to you.
applicant.a5:
With this function, you commission us to actively search for suitable positions for you:

Advantages:
• We search our network for suitable positions
• You are informed about new opportunities
• Personal support from our team
• Access to non-publicly advertised positions

How it works:
1. Complete your profile
2. Select your desired job type(s)

legal.q1: Do I need a visa for Germany?
legal.a1:
This depends on your nationality:

EU citizens: No visa required, free labor market access

Third-country nationals:
• For short-term employment (max. 90 days): Often work permit through Federal Employment Agency
• For longer-term employment: Work visa required

We support you in applying for the necessary permits and advise on the requirements.
legal.a2:
Short-term employment is a special regulation:

• Duration: Maximum 90 days or 3 months per calendar year
• For: Students from certain countries (e.g., Ukraine, Moldova)
• Advantage: Simplified procedure without residence permit

Requirements:
• Valid enrollment certificate
• Placement through licensed agency (like IJP)
• Approval from Federal Employment Agency

We take care of all formalities!
legal.q3: What working hours apply in Germany?
legal.a3:
The following regulations apply in Germany:

• Maximum working time: 8 hours/day, max. 10 hours with compensation
• Breaks: After 6 hours min. 30 min., after 9 hours min. 45 min.
• Rest period: Min. 11 hours between working days
• Weekend: Generally work-free (exceptions in certain industries)

Minimum wage (2025): €13.90/hour
legal.a4:
Data protection is our highest priority:

• All data is processed in accordance with GDPR
• SSL-encrypted transmission
• Storage on German servers
• Disclosure only with your consent to potential employers
• Deletion possible on request at any time

More information can be found in our privacy policy.

technical.a1:
For documents we accept:

• PDF (recommended) - Maximum file size: 10 MB

Please ensure that:
• Documents are clearly legible
• No password-protected PDFs are used
• Translations are certified (if required)
technical.a2:
No problem! Here's how to reset it:

1. Go to the login page
2. Click on "Forgot password?"
3. Enter your email address
4. You will receive a reset link by email
5. Choose a new secure password

The link is valid for 24 hours. If you don't receive an email, check your spam folder.
technical.q3: How can I delete my account?
technical.a3:
You can delete your account yourself at any time:

1. Log in
2. Go to "Settings"
3. Scroll to "Delete Account"
4. Confirm with your password and "DELETE"

Warning: This action is irreversible. All your data, applications, and documents will be permanently deleted.
technical.q4: Who can I contact if I have problems?
technical.a4:
Our support team is happy to help:

Email: service@internationaljobplacement.com

Contact form: Via our contact page

We usually respond within 24-48 hours.
